description: [Status: stable] [Name: root-logger-call] [Message: {}() call on root logger] What it does Checks for usages of the following logging top-level functions: debug, info, warn, warning, error, critical, log, exception. Why is this bad? Using the root logger causes the messages to have no source information, making them less useful for debugging. Example import logging logging.info("Foobar") Use instead: import logging logger = logging.getLogger(__name__) logger.info("Foobar")
